content.text: Amazon Web Services (**AWS**) is a comprehensive **cloud computing** platform
Offers a wide range of **services** and **tools** for computing, storage, and more
Used by individuals, businesses, and governments worldwide for **scalability** and **reliability

slides.title: Slide 2: History of AWS

content.text: **2002**: AWS launched as an internal project within Amazon
**2006**: AWS introduced its first **web services**, including **S3** and **SQS**
Since then, AWS has grown to become one of the leading **cloud providers**

slides.notes: Provide a brief history of AWS.

slides.title: Slide 3: Benefits of Using AWS

content.text: **Scalability**: easily scale up or down to meet changing **workload** demands
**Cost-effectiveness**: pay only for the **resources** you use

slides.notes: Highlight the advantages of using AWS.

slides.title: Slide 4: AWS Services
slides.notes: Introduce the main categories of AWS services.

slides.title: Slide 5: AWS Security

content.text: **IAM**: Identity and Access Management for **access control**
**Cognito**: user identity and **access management** for **web** and **mobile** apps

slides.notes: Discuss the importance of security in AWS.

slides.title: Slide 6: AWS Pricing

content.text: **Pay-as-you-go**: pay only for the **resources** you use

slides.notes: Explain the different pricing models in AWS.

slides.title: Slide 7: AWS Support
slides.notes: Describe the different support options available in AWS.

slides.title: Slide 8: AWS Certification
slides.notes: Discuss the importance of AWS certification.

slides.title: Slide 9: AWS Architecture
slides.notes: Explain the components of AWS architecture.

slides.title: Slide 10: AWS Migration
slides.notes: Outline the steps involved in migrating to AWS.

slides.title: Slide 11: AWS Best Practices
slides.notes: Discuss the importance of following best practices in AWS.

slides.title: Slide 12: Conclusion

content.text: AWS is a powerful **cloud computing** platform
Offers a wide range of **services** and **tools** for **scalability** and **reliability**
Follow **best practices** and **security** measures for optimal **performance**

slides.notes: Summarize the key points and encourage further exploration of AWS.
